ch0096_10_zumi/0101_0701_01_10:
Welcome back, [EN:Gen Ref="255" M="Mr." F="Miss" ] [Name:PlayerNickname ].
Would you care to start with an appetizer?
ch0096_10_zumi/0101_0701_02_10:
Ah, my apologies... It’s this uniform. While I’m
wearing it, my way of speaking automatically
shifts into customer service mode.
ch0096_10_zumi/0601_0701_01_10:
When I’m shorthanded at the restaurant,
I sometimes serve food to the guests myself.
ch0096_10_zumi/0601_0701_02_10:
It makes my busy days even busier, but I don’t
mind the extra work at all.
ch0096_10_zumi/0601_0701_03_10:
Simply having the chance to see my guests’
eyes light up with joy as I place their meals
before them is reward enough.
ch0096_10_zumi/0601_0701_04_10:
Nothing makes a chef happier than to see his
guests smile.
ch0096_10_zumi/0601_0702_01_10:
Sometimes my guests call me to their table
to share their thoughts on the meal.
ch0096_10_zumi/0601_0702_02_10:
They smile and tell me how they loved my choice
of spices in the main course or enjoyed the nice
textures in the dessert.
ch0096_10_zumi/0601_0702_03_10:
I love hearing that feedback. It makes me want
to delight and surprise my guests with even
more delicious dishes in the future.
ch0096_10_zumi/0602_0701_01_10:
What do you think makes a meal truly excellent?
It’s more than just how delicious the food is—I can
tell you that.
ch0096_10_zumi/0602_0701_02_10:
The aesthetics of the garnishing and plating, the
timing of each course, and the overall atmosphere
of the restaurant are all deeply important.
ch0096_10_zumi/0602_0701_03_10:
I believe there’s value in taking the time to step
out to the front where my guests are dining
and check these things myself.
ch0096_10_zumi/0602_0701_04_10:
Or...maybe I just like seeing my guests smiling.
Who knows? *chuckle*
ch0096_10_zumi/0602_0702_01_10:
Sometimes I do go out and walk by the tables at
my restaurant, but I’m no match for the waitstaff.
ch0096_10_zumi/0602_0702_02_10:
They are masters in their own right. I’m constantly
impressed by how quietly and efficiently they’re
able to move about the dining area.
ch0096_10_zumi/0602_0702_03_10:
I can rest easy knowing the restaurant guests
are in very good hands.
ch0096_10_zumi/0603_0701_01_10:
Octillery and I first encountered one another
on a beach.
ch0096_10_zumi/0603_0701_02_10:
I was there with my Clawitzer to procure some
new ingredients to work with.
ch0096_10_zumi/0603_0701_03_10:
As we were walking, Clawitzer bristled at
something hiding among the rocks, so he shot
toward it with Water Gun...
ch0096_10_zumi/0603_0701_04_10:
and out jumped Octillery! In a way, I suppose
we started off as enemies more than friends.
ch0096_10_zumi/0603_0702_01_10:
As soon as Octillery spotted us, he attacked
with Octazooka.
ch0096_10_zumi/0603_0702_02_10:
Thankfully, we were able to dodge it for the most
part, but a little bit of ink from the blast managed
to splash into my mouth in the process.
ch0096_10_zumi/0603_0702_03_10:
As soon as the flavor hit me, I knew...
If used as a cooking ingredient, Octillery’s ink
could have endless potential!
ch0096_10_zumi/0604_0701_01_10:
Octillery’s ink is actually safe to cook with
and eat.
ch0096_10_zumi/0604_0701_02_10:
It has a deep, robust, complex flavor...
Simple words like “sweet” or “salty” or “spicy”
can’t even begin to describe the spectrum of it.
ch0096_10_zumi/0604_0701_03_10:
I knew from the moment I tasted it that in the
hands of an expert like myself, Octillery’s ink
could be used to create a new kind of food!
ch0096_10_zumi/0604_0701_04_10:
I wanted to learn everything I could about
Octillery, so we spent a lot of time together.
ch0096_10_zumi/0604_0702_01_10:
Octillery’s ink isn’t poisonous, but it can cause
a peculiar reaction when handled, so there are
certain precautions you have to take.
ch0096_10_zumi/0604_0702_02_10:
The ink contains a substance that can dull our
sense of smell. If you come into contact with it,
your nose may not work very well for a while.
ch0096_10_zumi/0604_0702_03_10:
That’s why I always advise wearing a mask
when extracting Octillery ink—to guard your
nose from the fumes.
ch0096_10_zumi/0605_0701_01_10:
I’d love to prepare you a full-course dinner
someday, [Name:PlayerNickname ].
Would that interest you?
ch0096_10_zumi/0605_0701_02_10:
Every step of the process would be handled by
yours truly, so you wouldn’t have to lift a finger.
ch0096_10_zumi/0605_0701_03_10:
I’ll take care of everything, from preparing the
food to setting the table—Chef Siebold’s full
dining experience.
ch0096_10_zumi/0605_0702_01_10:
I’d like to use Octillery’s ink in at least one of
the courses. Yes, that would be a must!
ch0096_10_zumi/0605_0702_02_10:
But sadly, I have yet to perfect a recipe that
uses it.
ch0096_10_zumi/0605_0702_03_10:
Soon! Soon I will finish my recipe and you can
look forward to tasting it—along with many other
delicious dishes—in your full-course dinner!
ch0096_10_zumi/1701_0701_01_10:
I came across this by chance when I was
shopping for ingredients. Would you like to
have it?
ch0096_10_zumi/1701_0701_02_10:
Use it well. I hope it helps you win a glorious
Pokémon battle!
ch0096_10_zumi/1701_0702_01_10: Oh, no need to thank me. Although...
ch0096_10_zumi/2501_0701_01_10:
When I wear this uniform, I’m forced to realize
that there are certain ideals and expectations
that come with food service.
ch0096_10_zumi/2501_0701_02_10:
To master waiting on guests in the dining area
would be to master a whole different art form.
ch0096_10_zumi/2501_0701_03_10:
While I would love to do so, perfecting both
serving and cooking would be a bit beyond
my reach.
ch0096_10_zumi/2501_0701_04_10:
My battle is in the kitchen, not the front of
the restaurant.
ch0096_10_zumi/2501_0702_01_10:
I think of my restaurant as a vast, complete
work of art with many working parts.
ch0096_10_zumi/2501_0702_02_10:
The chef who cooks the food, the staff who serve
the guests in the front—all are vitally important.
ch0096_10_zumi/2501_0702_03_10:
It’s the joy of sharing a meal and the sense of
community that that creates. It’s one big work
of art.
ch0096_10_zumi/2501_0702_04_10:
One person can’t create something like that alone.
It’s easy to get bigheaded as a chef, so I try to
remind myself of that from time to time.
ch0096_10_zumi/2511_0701_01_10:
Most Octillery like to spend their days in dark,
cramped spaces like caves and grottoes.
ch0096_10_zumi/2511_0701_02_10:
But ever since my Octillery and I became partners,
he’s worked right alongside me, even in the
brightest places.
ch0096_10_zumi/2511_0701_03_10:
I could be reaching, but I like to think that
Octillery’s odd behavior is proof that he really
trusts me.
ch0096_10_zumi/2511_0701_04_10:
If I’m correct, it would be terribly rude of me to
trust Octillery any less in return. I always keep
that in the back of my mind.
ch0096_10_zumi/2511_0702_01_10:
I can see it as plain as day when I look at you
and your Pokémon.
ch0096_10_zumi/2511_0702_02_10:
You two have a deep trust for one another
as partners.
ch0096_10_zumi/2511_0702_03_10:
The beautiful harmony you create together
could be described as art.
ch0096_10_zumi/3001_0701_01_10:
Good morning. Would you care for a smoothie
to boost your energy for the day?
ch0096_10_zumi/3002_0701_01_10:
Breakfast is the most important meal of the day.
I always try to eat something, even when I’m
in a rush.
ch0096_10_zumi/3003_0701_01_10:
Good afternoon. Would you care for a light lunch?
I have several options prepared.
ch0096_10_zumi/3004_0701_01_10:
It’s getting close to dinnertime. I should go and
make sure the dining area is ready for the
evening rush.
ch0096_10_zumi/3005_0701_01_10:
Good evening. Dinner is being served as we
speak, if you’d like to follow me to your table.
ch0096_10_zumi/3006_0701_01_10:
A good night’s sleep is my recipe for success.
I avoid late-night snacking since it tends to keep
me awake.
